thread.title: ‘Searching for Stars on an Island in Maine’ Review: A Longing for Truth and Meaning

author: Alan Hirshfeld
title: ‘Searching for Stars on an Island in Maine’ Review: A Longing for Truth and Meaning
text: From the astronomer’s perspective, to look outward is to look inward. The lines of sight into space, taken together, converge back onto oneself, creating an inescapable impression of centeredness. No wonder the prospect of a star-studded sky elicits a sense of connection with the universe, weaving one’s consciousness into the cosmic matrix. Some astronomers report a rush of spiritual feeling that conjures planes of existence distinct from the material world. Perhaps the most solemn facet of the glittering celestial vault, besides its looming presence, is its utter silence: The soundless austerity of the cosmos calls...
